arts.ttl: Girona 0-1 Liverpool: Arne Slot reveals Alisson Becker "joke" after Champions League masterclass
arts.sum: Liverpool manager Arne Slot reveals a "joke" between his players and Alisson Becker after the goalkeeper's fabulous performance against Girona in the Champions League.

arts.ttl: Arne Slot far from happy with Liverpool performance in Girona victory
arts.sum: Mohamed Salah’s 63rd-minute penalty proved to be the difference at Girona.

arts.ttl: Fuming Arne Slot declares himself 'far from pleased' as he tears into Liverpool performance - despite making it six wins from six against Girona in the Champions League
arts.sum: LEWIS STEELE AT THE ESTADI MONTILIVI: A Mohamed Salah penalty in the second half kept up the Reds' 100 per cent record in the Champions League to all but secure their knockout berth.

arts.ttl: Mohamed Salah penalty at Girona sees Liverpool maintain perfect Champions League record
arts.sum: Alisson, Gomez, Van Dijk, Diaz (Endo, 88), Szoboszlai, Nunez (Gakpo, 70), Salah, Jones (Elliott, 76), Robertson, Gravenberch, Alexander-Arnold. Paulo Gazzaniga stopped Joe Gomez from scoring his first Liverpool goal after four minutes by clawing away the defender's header from an Andy Robertson corner.

arts.ttl: Liverpool rode their luck in Girona win - Warnock
arts.sum: Stephen Warnock believes Liverpool were not at their best in the 1-0 Champions League win at Girona.

arts.ttl: Arne Slot singles out Liverpool star as he delivers brutal response to Girona win
arts.sum: Liverpool all-but secured their place in the last 16 of the Champions League with a 1-0 win over Girona in Spain, but Arne Slot was less than impressed with his side's display

arts.ttl: 'Chaotic' Star's Display in win vs Girona Proves Liverpool Need to Upgrade
arts.sum: The Reds' win proved they need to upgrade one player

arts.ttl: Mohamed Salah’s penalty sinks Girona to make it six wins from six for Liverpool
arts.sum: Liverpool’s perfect Champions League continued and a new record was completed with a sixth win and a fifth clean sheet. Arne Slot’s side have now not conceded since the third minute of the opening night at San Siro, their best ever run in Europe. They also have their goalkeeper back, and on a cold night at Montilivi those things were related. Mohamed Salah’s penalty secured a 1-0 victory against Girona, but this was also about Alisson who made five saves on his return to help virtually secure a place in the last 16 with two matches to spare. If the record is perfect, the performance was not, Slot saying he was “far from pleased” with how Liverpool had played. In the end, though, it was enough: routine and maybe a bit bureaucratic, the coach complaining at a lack of intensity. The penalty that won it certainly was, decreed by the video assistant referee, a magnifying glass held over a minor misdemeanour. Luis Díaz went down under a challenge from Donny van de Beek, his boot lost. “When I saw that, I thought: ‘He’s going to give it,’” the Girona coach, Michel Sánchez, admitted. “It’s not the kind of penalty I like but it is where we are with VAR.” Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Liverpool sit pretty at top of table after Girona win and Celtic draw in Zagreb
arts.sum: The Reds have won all six matches this term.

arts.ttl: Liverpool win 1-0 at Girona to stay perfect in UCL
arts.sum: Mohamed Salah's penalty helped Liverpool maintain their 100% record in this season's Champions League with a 1-0 win at Girona on Tuesday
